snippet: On issues like gun control, the states are not powerless in the face of federal law, but there are limits to what they can do to prevent enforcement of constitutionally valid regulation.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Cato Institute chairman Robert A Levy asserts that on issues like gun control, states are not powerless in the face of federal law, but there are limits to what they can do to prevent enforcement of constitutionally valid regulation.
lead_paragraph: On issues like gun control, the states are not powerless in the face of federal law, but there are limits to what they can do to prevent enforcement of constitutionally valid regulation.
